qas.question: What is the life expectancy in Namibia?
What epidemic is a large problem in Namibia?
How much of the Namibian population is infected with HIV?
How many people living in 2001 had HIV/AIDS in Namibia?
How many deaths were associated with HIV/AIDS in Namibia in 2003?
How many orphans are there in Namibia?
How many people in Botswana have HIV/AIDS?
What percentage of the people in Botswana have HIV?
What is the HIV/AIDS epidemic numbers doing in Botswana?
What is the age expectancy in Botswana as of 2012?

context: Life expectancy at birth is estimated to be <a0_0><b9_0>52.2<b9_0/><a0_0/> years in 2012 – among the lowest in the world. The <a1_0>AIDS<a1_0/> epidemic is a large problem in Namibia. Though its rate of infection is substantially lower than that of its eastern neighbour, Botswana, approximately <a2_0><b7_0>13.1%<b7_0/><a2_0/> of the adult population is[update] infected with HIV. In 2001, there were an estimated <a3_0><b6_0>210,000<b6_0/><a3_0/> people living with HIV/AIDS, and the estimated death toll in 2003 was <a4_0><b5_0>16,000<b5_0/>.<a4_0/> According to the 2011 UNAIDS Report, the epidemic in Namibia <b8_0>"appears to be leveling off."<b8_0/> As the HIV/AIDS epidemic has reduced the working-aged population, the number of orphans has increased. It falls to the government to provide education, food, shelter and clothing for these orphans.
